snippet: Amid an increasing emphasis on the importance of early literacy, libraries in New York are seeing attendance surge at the once-informal reading circles that are becoming fixtures of family routines.
abstract: Story time programs for children offered by New York Public Library system are so popular among parents that they result in lines out the door at local libraries across five boroughs, with seats at readings as coveted as tickets to biggest Broadway shows; popularity of such programs at libraries nationwide has spiked as educators have underscored importance of early literacy in children's education and development.
lead_paragraph: Amid an increasing emphasis on the importance of early literacy, libraries in New York are seeing attendance surge at the once-informal reading circles that are becoming fixtures of family routines.

headline.main: Long Line at the Library? It’s Story Time Again
headline.print_headline: Long Line at the Library? It’s Story Time Again
